rules.to: /* payload[0]~>$sift(function($v,$k){ $k~>/col/}) */	(	   $header := payload[0]~>$each(function($v,$k) { { "key" : $k, "val" : $v} } );	   {	     "header" : $header,	     "last_date_retrieved" : $header[-1].val,	     "last_col_min_8" : $header[-8],	     "location" : payload[col2 != "Country/Region"].(	        $new_cases_current   := ($lookup($,$header[-1].key)-$lookup($,$header[-8].key))/7;	        $new_cases_1day_ago  := ($lookup($,$header[-2].key)-$lookup($,$header[-9].key))/7; 	        $new_cases_8days_ago  := ($lookup($,$header[-9].key)-$lookup($,$header[-16].key))/7;     	        $new_cases_1week_ago := ($lookup($,$header[-8].key)-$lookup($,$header[-15].key))/7;	        $new_cases_2week_ago := ($lookup($,$header[-15].key)-$lookup($,$header[-22].key))/7;	        $new_cases_3week_ago := ($lookup($,$header[-22].key)-$lookup($,$header[-29].key))/7;    	        $new_cases_4week_ago := ($lookup($,$header[-29].key)-$lookup($,$header[-36].key))/7; 	        {	         "province_state" : col1,	         "country_region" : col2,	         "latitude"       : col3,	         "longitude"      : col4,	         "distance"       : -1,	         "total_conf_cases": $lookup($,$header[-1].key),	         "new_cases_current" : $new_cases_current,	         "new_cases_1week_ago" : $new_cases_1week_ago,	         "reproduction_number" :   $new_cases_1week_ago = 0 	                                   ? ($new_cases_current = 0 ? 0 : 9999)	                                   : ($new_cases_current/$new_cases_1week_ago)~>$round(2),	         "reproduction_number_1day_ago" : $new_cases_8days_ago = 0 	                                          ? ($new_cases_8days_ago = 0 ? 0 : 9999)	                                          : ($new_cases_1day_ago/$new_cases_8days_ago)~>$round(2),	         "reproduction_number_1week_ago" :   $new_cases_2week_ago = 0 	                                             ? ($new_cases_1week_ago = 0 ? 0 : 9999)	                                             : ($new_cases_1week_ago/$new_cases_2week_ago)~>$round(2),	         "reproduction_number_2week_ago" :   $new_cases_3week_ago = 0 	                                             ? ($new_cases_2week_ago = 0 ? 0 : 9999)	                                             : ($new_cases_2week_ago/$new_cases_3week_ago)~>$round(2),  	         "reproduction_number_3week_ago" :   $new_cases_4week_ago = 0 	                                             ? ($new_cases_3week_ago = 0 ? 0 : 9999)	                                             : ($new_cases_3week_ago/$new_cases_4week_ago)~>$round(2)	        }	      )	   }	   	)

payload~> | $ | (	    $cur_country := $.country_region;	    $population := $$.countries[name = $cur_country  ].population;	    /* if multipe matches then duplicates in countries list and in that case population is set to -999999 */	    $count($population)> 1 ? $population := -999999;	    {	     "population_in_million" : $population/1000~>$round(2),	     "new_cases_per_million" : new_cases_current*1000/$population ~>$round(2),	     "total_cases_per_million" : total_conf_cases*1000/$population ~>$round(0)	     } ) |

template:
column field description
1 location country / state
2 distance distance in km from the country you have selected in the dropdown menu.
-1 if no country is selected.
3 cases/day/million average number of confirmed cases per day (over the last 7 days) per million persons.
we have taken an average over the last 7 days to filter out any weekend effects.
4 RN (Repr. Nr) Reproduction number which is defined as
(conf_cases_last_week / conf_cases_week_before)
where conf_cases_last_week is the total number of new confirmed cases registered last week. A week is chosen to filter out any weekend effects.
A RN of 9999 indicates that previous week no cases were reported while this week at least one case has been reported.
5 RN (-1 day) same as previous column but then calculated for the previous day. So tomorrow this column shows the same value you can see today in previous column.
6 RN (-1week) same as 3rd column but then calculated for the previous week. So a week later this column will show the same value as you can see today in 3rd column.
7 RN (-2week) same as 3rd column but then calculated for 2 weeks ago. So 2 weeks later this column will show the same value as you can see today in 3rd column.
8 RN (-3week) same as 3rd column but then calculated for 3 weeks ago.
9 tot. cases/million total confirmed cases (at date retrieved) per million. So this includes all confirmed cases.
10 popul. [million] total country population expressed in million.
11 tot. cases total reported confirmed cases.

rules.to:
( /* 3 color gradient green (0,255,0) - yellow (255, 255, 0) - red (255,0,0) note that class tag is added as a hack to assure that sorting is workign properly */ $rep_nr_with_style_fn := function($rep_nr){ "
" & $rep_nr & "
" }; payload ~> | $ | { "html_reproduction_number" : $rep_nr_with_style_fn(reproduction_number), "html_reproduction_number_1day_ago" : $rep_nr_with_style_fn(reproduction_number_1day_ago), "html_reproduction_number_1week_ago" : $rep_nr_with_style_fn(reproduction_number_1week_ago), "html_reproduction_number_2week_ago" : $rep_nr_with_style_fn(reproduction_number_2week_ago), "html_reproduction_number_3week_ago" : $rep_nr_with_style_fn(reproduction_number_3week_ago) } | )

name: calculate distance
US - grouped by cases per state

rules.to: payload.(	    $new_cases_current   := (cases[-1].total - cases[-8].total)/7;	    $new_cases_1day_ago  := (cases[-2].total - cases[-9].total)/7; 	    $new_cases_1week_ago := (cases[-8].total - cases[-15].total)/7; 	    $new_cases_8days_ago := (cases[-9].total - cases[-16].total)/7;     	    $new_cases_2week_ago := (cases[-15].total- cases[-22].total)/7; 	    $new_cases_3week_ago := (cases[-22].total- cases[-29].total)/7;   	    $new_cases_4week_ago := (cases[-29].total- cases[-36].total)/7; 	    {	    "state" : state,	     "last_date" : cases[-1].date,	     "total_conf_cases": cases[-1].total,	     "new_cases_current"   : $new_cases_current,	     "new_cases_1week_ago" : $new_cases_1week_ago,	     "reproduction_number" :   $new_cases_1week_ago = 0 	                                   ? ($new_cases_current = 0 ? 0 : 9999)	                                   : ($new_cases_current/$new_cases_1week_ago)~>$round(2),	     "reproduction_number_1day_ago" : $new_cases_8days_ago = 0 	                                          ? ($new_cases_8days_ago = 0 ? 0 : 9999)	                                          : ($new_cases_1day_ago/$new_cases_8days_ago)~>$round(2),	     "reproduction_number_1week_ago" :   $new_cases_2week_ago = 0 	                                             ? ($new_cases_1week_ago = 0 ? 0 : 9999)	                                             : ($new_cases_1week_ago/$new_cases_2week_ago)~>$round(2),	     "reproduction_number_2week_ago" :   $new_cases_3week_ago = 0 	                                             ? ($new_cases_2week_ago = 0 ? 0 : 9999)	                                             : ($new_cases_2week_ago/$new_cases_3week_ago)~>$round(2),  	     "reproduction_number_3week_ago" :   $new_cases_4week_ago = 0 	                                             ? ($new_cases_3week_ago = 0 ? 0 : 9999)	                                             : ($new_cases_3week_ago/$new_cases_4week_ago)~>$round(2)	         	    }	)

payload~> | $ | (	     $cur_state := state;	     $population := $$.population_us_states[name = $cur_state  ].population;	     /* if multipe matches then duplicates in population_us_states list and in that case population is set to -999999 */	     $count($population)> 1 ? $population := -999999;	        {	           "country_region"        : state,	           "population_in_million" : $population/1000~>$round(2),	           "new_cases_per_million" : new_cases_current*1000/$population ~>$round(2),	           "total_cases_per_million" : total_conf_cases*1000/$population ~>$round(0)	           } ) |
